alert.note: Alert for Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 10:39AM CDT until May 06 at 8:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN NOBLE...SOUTHEASTERN LOGAN AND CENTRAL PAYNE COUNTIES... At 1039 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Meridian, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Perkins, Langston, Glencoe, Coyle, Meridian, Lake Carl Blackwell and Lake Mcmurtry. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
